reference.title: Properties in the Config File for Silent Installation

section.p: The following table lists the properties in the config file along with the details of their use. If no valueis specified in the setup file, the default value will be used.

li.p: The [shared_...] entry consists of the properties shared by OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME and Agents.
The [protect_...] entry consists of the properties exclusive to OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME Agent.
The [legacy_...] entry consists of the properties exclusive to Agent.

entry.p: Entry
Property
Default Value
Description
empty string
The product serial number and license file used for license activation
empy string
server.crt
hostname or IP address
The certificate filename for communicating with
empy string
FQDN, hostname or IP address of Intranet proxy server
empy string
Port number of Intranet proxy server
empy string
Username of Intranet proxy server, required only when the proxy server is configured to authenticate by username and password.
empy string
Administrator's password. The password will be required by specific functions, including uninstallation, the command line interface, and support tools.

Execute installation in silent mode. Possible values:
0: Do not use silent mode
1: Use silent mode

note.p: To install in silent mode, you must also specify the password value. For example:

The client listening port for

component update server link
empty string
Use an installation sample config file to run the silent installation. Choose one of the ways:

Specify the sample file name and put the file as the top-level file in the installer package

The vendor's name of the asset.

Enable OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME in the Windows start menu.
Enable OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME icon to be placed on the desktop.
Enable OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME in the Windows system tray.
Allow the installer to install ICS code signing certificates during installation.
Enable malware scan during installation.
Enable the building of Approved List for Application Lockdown.
Enable the "detect" mode of Application Lockdown.
0: None
1: Quarantine
1: only executes when the sytem is in idle status
0: always consumes CPU resource for executing prescan
0: Normal (Single thread scan)
1: HIGH (Multi-thread scan
empty string
Use an agent settings sample config file to import the same settings to the target agents.
Specify the path to the folder containing the config file to be imported, e.g., C:\txsp_config
boolean
false
Bypass checking Windows Defender status.

Prescan the endpoint before installing . Possible values:
0: Do not prescan the endpoint
1: Prescan the endpoint
Windows Event Log size (KB). Possible values: Positive integer

note.p: Default value for new installations. Upgrading does not change any user- defined WEL_SIZE values set in the previous installation.

entry.p: Windows Event Log option when maximum event log size is reached on Windows Event Log. Possible values:

For Windows XP or earlier platforms:
0: Overwrite events as needed
1~365: Overwrite events older than (1~365) days
-1: Do not overwrite events (clear logs manually)

For Windows Vista or later platforms:
0: Overwrite events as needed (oldest events first)
1: Archive the log when full, do not overwrite events.
-1: Do not overwrite events (clear logs manually)
Windows Event Log size for Integrity Monitor events (KB). Possible values: Positive integer
Windows Event Log option for when maximum event log size for Integrity Monitor events is reached in the Windows Event Log.

For Windows XP or earlier platforms:
0: Overwrite events as needed
1~365: Overwrite events older than (1~365) days
-1: Do not overwrite events (clear logs manually)

For Windows Vista or later platforms:
0: Overwrite events as needed (oldest events first)
1: Archive the log when full, do not overwrite events.
-1: Do not overwrite events (clear logs manually)

Enable debug logging for user sessions. Possible values:
0: Do not log
1: Log
The number of debug log entries allowed for user sessions

Enable debug logging for service sessions. Possible values:
0: Do not log
1: Log
The number of debug log entries allowed for service sessions

Enable debug log in user session of firewall. Possible values:
0: Disable debug log
1: Enable debug log
Debug level in user session of firewall. Possible values: number

Enable debug log in service session of firewall. Possible values:
0: Disable debug log
1: Enable debug log
Debug level in service session of firewall. Possible values: number

Enable debug log of Behavior Monitoring Core service. Possible values:
0: Disable debug log
1: Enable debug log
Debug level of Behavior Monitoring Core service

Enable Integrity Monitor. Possible values:
0: Disable
1: Enable

Enable Predefined Trusted Updater. Possible values:
0: Disable
1: Enable

Enable Windows Update Support. Possible values:
0: Disable
1: Enable

Blocks storage devices, including CD/DVD drives, floppy disks,and USB devices, from accessing managed endpoints. Possible values:
0: Allow access from storage devices
1: Block access from storage devices

Initialize the Approved List during installation. Possible values:
0: Do not initialize the Approved list During installation
1: Initialize the Approved List during installation

note.p: LIST_PATH has priority over INIT_LIST. For example: If
liststore.db is imported and INIT_LIST is ignored.

entry.p:
Turn Application Lockdown on after installation. Possible values:
0: Turn off Application Lockdown
1: Turn on Application Lockdown

Enable the Fileless Attack Prevention feature. Possible values:
0: Disable
1: Enable

Enable the Service Creation Prevention feature. Possible values:
0: Disable
1: Enable

note.p: temporarily disables the Service Creation Prevention feature under the following conditions:

li.p: Updating or installing new applications using installers allowed by Trusted Updater. The feature is automatically re-enabled after the Trusted Updater process is complete
Disabling Windows Update Support automatically re-enables the feature

row.entry:
The agent will allow runtime execution files that are generated by applications in the Approved List. Possible values:
0: Disable
1: Enable

Create a shortcut on desktop. Possible values:
0: Create shortcut
1: Do not create shortcut

entry.p:
Create a shortcut in the Start menu. Possible values:
0: Create shortcut
1: Do not create shortcut

Display the system tray icon and Windows notifications. Possible values:
0: Create system tray icon
1: Do not create system tray icon

Custom action for blocked events. Possible values:
0: Ignore
1: Quarantine
2: Ask server
Maximum database file size (MB). Possible values: Positive integer

Install firewall for network virus protection. Possible values:
0: Create firewall
1: Do not create firewall
log
Afile extension to exclude from automatic file enumeration for Approved List initialization.
The configuration applies to the Approved List first initialized and all subsequent Approved List updates.
Specify multiple extensions by creating new entries with names that start with INIT_LIST_EXCLUDED_EXTENSION, while ensuring that each entry name is unique. For example:

note.p: Specifying file extensions of executable files (e.g., exe, dll and sys) may cause issues with Application Lockdown.

entry.p: txt
ini

Attempt to clean detected files during prescan. Possible values:
0: No action
1: Clean, or delete if the clean action is unsuccessful
2: Clean, or quarantine if the clean action is unsuccessful
3: Clean, or ignore if the clean action is unsuccessful
Cancel installation after detecting malware threat during prescan. Possible values:

li.p: 1: Continue installation after detecting malware threat during prescan
2: Continue installation when no malware is detected, or after all detected malware is cleaned, deleted, or quarantined successfully without a system reboot

entry.p: empy string
Anabsolute folder path where prescan result reports are saved. Possible values:
Full

The type of scan executed during silent installation. Possible values:
Full: Scan all folders on the endpoint
Quick: Scans the following folders:
Fixed root drives, e.g.,
c:\
d:\
System root folder, e.g.,
c:\Windows
System folder, e.g.,
c:\Windows\System
System32 folder, e.g.,
c:\Windows\System32
Driver folder, e.g.,
c:\Windows\System32\Drivers
Temp folder, e.g.,
c:\Users\Trend\AppData\Local\Temp
Desktop folder including sub folders and files, e.g.,
c:\Users\Trend\Desktop
Specific: Scan folders specified with SPECIFIC_FOLDER entries

note.p: The selected valueis used as the default value for a UI installation

entry.p: The number of compressed layers to scan when a compressed file is scanned. Possible values:

li.p: 1~20: Scan up to the specified number of layers of a compressed file

entry.p:
The largest file allowed for scan
0: Scan files of any sizes
1~9999: Only scan files equal to or smaller than the specified size (MB)

Scan removable drives. Possible values:
0: Do not scan removable drives
1: Scan removable drives

Perform a prescan before installation. Possible values:
0: Disable
1: Enable

note.p: To enable this feature, make sure to also enable the display for system tray icons and notifications. See NO_SYSTRAY in this table for details.

entry.p:

Start maintenance mode with this duration immediately after the install process is finished. Possible values:
Unit: Hours

Enable file scanning after the maintenance period. Possible values:
0: No scan (default)
1: Quarantine
scans files that are created, executed, or modified during the maintenance period and quarantine detected files
2: al
scans files that are created, executed, or modified during the maintenance period and adds these files (including files that are detected as malicious) to the Approved List
Starting interval, in seconds, between attempts to resend an event to StellarOne
This interval doubles in size for each unsuccessful attempt, until it exceeds the MAX_RETRY_ITERVAL value
Possible values: 0~2147483647
Maximum interval, in seconds, between attempts to resend events to StellarOne
Possible values: 0~2147483647

note.p: agents respond as soon as possible to direct requests from StellarOne. For details, refer to Applying Message Time Groups in the Administrator's Guide

entry.p: Number of groups controlled by the server. Possible values:
Index of group which this agent belongs to. Possible values:
Maximum amount of time agents have to upload data (in seconds). Possible values:

li.p: When ENABLE_PRESCAN is set to 0, ENABLE_LOCKDOWN_AL_BUILDING and ENABLE_LOCKDOWN_DETECTION will be automatically set to 0.

BYPASS_WINDEFEND_CHECK is a hidden property in , designed for Windows 7 and Windows Server 2016+ platforms, on which the installation of OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME requires disabling Windows Defender. When its value is specified as 1, the endpoint will bypass Windows Defender check to get the OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME installed without disabling Windows Defender.

If you would like to bypass checking Windows Defender status to get the OFFICIAL_PRODUCT_NAME installed without disabling Windows Defender, insert a line under the [protect_install] section. Type bypass_windefend_check: 1
